description: Students experience the dynamic arts and governance environment of Washington, D. C., meeting over 25 professionals in varied fields and visiting galleries, museums, theaters, music and dance presenters, arts and civic organizations. The course compares/contrasts expectations for a life in the arts with new options. Students embrace interdisciplinarity, collaborate, and discuss, write, and reflect on the arts and democracy. Students participate in a civic engagement project. Offered periodically during Interim. Counts toward art, art history, and dance majors. Prerequisites: at least one fine arts course or arts management course or permission of the instructor.
name: The Arts and Democracy
notes: You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: at least one fine arts course or arts management course or permission of the instructor.
title: Arts and Democracy: An ID Fine Arts Interim in Washington, D.C.
